Actions.ActionName: CLEANUP (Delete) VARIABLES -- In Case Macro Was Cancelled Previously
SCRIPT:  DELETE All Variables with KMVarPrefix and in KMVars_To_Delete
Actions.Text:
tell application "Keyboard Maestro Engine"
	
	--- DELETE ALL KM VARIABLES WITH THIS PREFIX ---
	
	set prefixStr to getvariable "KMVarPrefix"
	
	if (prefixStr ≠ "") then
		set value of variables whose name starts with prefixStr to "%Delete%"
		--display notification "All KM Variables with PREFIX = '" & prefixStr & ¬
		--	"' have been deleted." with title "Keyboard Maestro Script"
	end if
	
	--- DELETE KM VARS IN THE VARIABLE "KMVars_To_Delete" ---
	
	set varsToDeleteList to paragraphs of (getvariable "KMVars_To_Delete")
	
	if (varsToDeleteList ≠ {}) then
		
		set varsToDeleteList to varsToDeleteList & {"KMVars_To_Delete"}
		
		repeat with oVar in varsToDeleteList
			setvariable (oVar as text) to "%Delete%"
		end repeat
		
		--display notification "All KM Variables in 'KMVars_To_Delete' have been deleted." with title "Keyboard Maestro Script"
		
	end if
	
end tell

Actions.ActionName: SCRIPT:  Get Current Tab Number in FrontMost Browser (AS)
Actions.Text:
set currentApp to path to frontmost application as text

if (currentApp contains "Safari") then
	
	tell application "Safari"
		set origTabNum to index of current tab of window 1
	end tell
	
else
	
	tell application "Google Chrome"
		set origTabNum to active tab index of window 1
	end tell
	
end if

return origTabNum

Actions.Title: %ExecutingMacro%
Actions.Prompt:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  CLICK BUTTON when ready to return to KM Post
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 
    BUTTON			KEY			ACTION
  • MarkDown Link		RETURN    	Paste MD Link into Post
  • Link URL			⌘U			Paste URL only
  • Link Text			⌘T			Paste Text only
  • Rescan			⌘R			Rescan Wiki Page (do not return)
  • Cancel			ESC			CANCEL MACRO

(NOTE: Prompt must have focus for Shortcut Keys to work.)

Check "CopyToClipboard" IF you want ONLY to copy the text, chosen by the button you click, to be Clipboard, and do NOT Paste.
.

GRP:  Close New Tabs Just Opened
SCRIPT:  Make Original Browser Tab Active (AS)
Actions.Text: ### Requires Keyboard Maestro 8.0.3+ ###set kmInst to system attribute "KMINSTANCE"tell application "Keyboard Maestro Engine"	set origTabNum to (getvariable "Local__OrigTabNum" instance kmInst) as numberend tellset currentApp to path to frontmost application as textif (currentApp contains "Safari") then		tell application "Safari"		set current tab of window 1 to (tab origTabNum of window 1)	end tell	else		tell application "Google Chrome"		set active tab index of window 1 to origTabNum	end tell	end ifreturn

Actions.ActionName: PAUSE:  Until Original Window Title is FrontMost
IF: PASTE into Post; OR Set CLIPBOARD

ElseActions.Title: %ExecutingMacro%
ElseActions.Subtitle: Clipboard SET to MD Link to KM Wiki

ThenActions.ActionName: DELETE  CLIPBOARDS Used in this macro

Actions.ActionName: CLEANUP (Delete) VARIABLES -- Macro Finished
SCRIPT:  DELETE All Variables with KMVarPrefix and in KMVars_To_Delete
Actions.Text:
tell application "Keyboard Maestro Engine"
	
	--- DELETE ALL KM VARIABLES WITH THIS PREFIX ---
	
	set prefixStr to getvariable "KMVarPrefix"
	
	if (prefixStr ≠ "") then
		set value of variables whose name starts with prefixStr to "%Delete%"
		--display notification "All KM Variables with PREFIX = '" & prefixStr & ¬
		--	"' have been deleted." with title "Keyboard Maestro Script"
	end if
	
	--- DELETE KM VARS IN THE VARIABLE "KMVars_To_Delete" ---
	
	set varsToDeleteList to paragraphs of (getvariable "KMVars_To_Delete")
	
	if (varsToDeleteList ≠ {}) then
		
		set varsToDeleteList to varsToDeleteList & {"KMVars_To_Delete"}
		
		repeat with oVar in varsToDeleteList
			setvariable (oVar as text) to "%Delete%"
		end repeat
		
		--display notification "All KM Variables in 'KMVars_To_Delete' have been deleted." with title "Keyboard Maestro Script"
		
	end if
	
end tell
